intro: Eriospora villosula, commonly known as the hairy eriospora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Eriospora villosula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
